title: Exclusive: Millwall in advanced talks with Gary Rowett over becoming the club's new manager
text:
Millwall are in advanced talks with Gary Rowett over becoming the Championship club's new manager.

Rowett was interviewed for a second time on Friday by club officials and is emerging as the favourite to be appointed as Neil Harris's replacement.

Millwall’s American chairman John Berylson flew to England last week to assist with the appointment and it is understood Rowett, 45, is now the club's preferred candidate.

The 3-2 defeat at Brentford on Saturday, in which Millwall threw away a two-goal lead under caretaker Adam Barrett, has convinced the club's board that an experienced manager is required.

Wycombe's Gareth Ainsworth was also under consideration but Rowett has impressed during two rounds of talks. If negotiations continue to progress, Rowett could watch his first game on Tuesday night against Cardiff from the stand at The Den.

Sacked by Stoke in January, despite just three defeats in his last 17 Championship games, Rowett is expected to name Callum Davidson, the former Leicester defender, as his assistant.
description: Millwall are in advanced talks with Gary Rowett over becoming the Championship club's new manager.
